alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; St. Landry; St. Martin; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:26AM CST until January 24 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern St. Landry Parish in central Louisiana... Lafayette Parish in south central Louisiana... Northwestern St. Martin Parish in south central Louisiana... Northern Vermilion Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 130 PM CST. * At 826 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lafayette, Abbeville, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Carencro, Kaplan, Gueydan, Krotz Springs, Arnaudville, Broussard, Youngsville, Erath, Delcambre, Duson, Henderson, Maurice, Ridge, Indian Bayou, Meaux and Cecilia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Lafayette; St. Landry; St. Martin; Vermilion
